Benefits

- Functioning: Many people keep work/relationships more stable when maintained on the lowest effective dose. Long‑acting injectables can further reduce rehospitalization for some.

- Metabolic changes: Weight gain, higher blood sugar, cholesterol, and blood pressure (highest with clozapine/olanzapine; lower with aripiprazole, ziprasidone, lurasidone, cariprazine). Over years, this raises heart and diabetes risk—worth monitoring and managing early.
- Movement disorders: Stiffness, restlessness (akathisia), and tardive dyskinesia (TD; involuntary movements). TD risk increases with age, duration, and dose and is higher in women; lower with clozapine/quetiapine than with older agents or high‑potency risperidone/paliperidone. - Hormonal/prolactin effects: Especially with risperidone, paliperidone, amisulpride—can cause missed periods, milk leakage, low libido, fertility changes, and, over time, bone loss. Options include switching to a prolactin‑sparing drug (aripiprazole, quetiapine) or adding low‑dose aripiprazole.
